title: Out of Africa: Travel and Ethnicity in Francophone African Writing
abstractText: This project will investigate the contribution of Sub-Saharan Francophone authors to travel writing. Using a largely postcolonial critical approach, the study will highlight generic boundaries as key to understanding both the exclusion of Africans from travel writing and the possibility for understanding their contribution to it. Focusing on several key text, the study will highlight the travel experiences of Francophone Africans in the West and examine what happens to notions to the traveller, the foreign, the exotic and travel writing when the tables are turned and Western culture is observed, and recorded, by black African travellers.
